data.text: @r3d_3v1l @nice_byte But yeah, deterrence à la nuclear sound like the more likely situation to me :/

@r3d_3v1l @nice_byte Interesting - so they can engineer a new variant of the vaccine in 6 weeks, but do they still need to go through the 3+ months of human trials? I wonder what the threshold is..

And I imagine improving deployment in less well off countries would also be difficult..
@nice_byte Actually first thing that crossed my mind while reading that article was bugs.

@jhaberstro @nice_byte Production can be improved, deployment likely too. Testing is more tricky: one could reduce it if desperate, but it's a risky business. Even a few weeks might be enough to do significant damage in your scenario. Maybe deterrence would be the way to go?
@r3d_3v1l @nice_byte That’s my point - testing and logistics (the “deployment”) will always be long enough for a bioweapon to wreak havoc IMO.

@jhaberstro @nice_byte For instance, BioNTech is claiming they can start production of a vaccine for a mutated COVID-19 strain within 6 weeks. Definitely one needs the genome of the virus first, but that does not take long either (at least did not happen for COVID). https://t.co/iEunPxx9We

@jhaberstro @nice_byte The actual sequencing of the mRNA used in the vaccine did not take long. Most of the time is testing + logistics. However, this is also the first generation of mRNA vaccines in commerce. Hopefully this technology will become common enough to allow for faster iteration.
@r3d_3v1l @nice_byte I do agree making the tech wide spread makes us safer, but I’m just not sure it’s enough to feel actually safe in absolute terms 😬

@r3d_3v1l @nice_byte Hasn’t COVID shown that developing and deploying any sort of reactionary defensive measure to a deadly virus (or bio weapon, presumably) takes years? That’s a lot of time for a bad actor to wreak havoc.
@begui @nice_byte Every doomsday prepper should have an RNA printer in their bag!
@nice_byte And seeing how stupid and irresponsible people are.... You're going to see me on the next episode of... Doomsday preppers
@nice_byte If you want to be really scared, think about injecting Norton Antivirus as a remedy to those bioweapons.

@nice_byte @jhaberstro The science behind this article has been developed in the last 20 years, meaning that bad actors, if any, might have been playing with it for some time. This tech becoming widespread makes us safer in such scenario, as it likely allows quicker development of counter measures
@nice_byte I think even the most evil and crazy people who could be in charge of such programmes realize the dangers of using it - but once they can "program" it to be specific enough...
@badlogicgames let's just hope they're more careful with it than the soviets with anthrax: https://t.co/VoCqUJiSd5

@BartWronsk yeah. we have goddamn machines for printing DNA, means of evading the nature's firewall, ways to get cells to print the exact specified proteins - and no-one used this to develop some nasty synthetic pathogen? don't believe it.
@nice_byte I am 100% sure numerous of those were already developed and waiting in some labs
